intro: Pearsonia mucronata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved pearsonia, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. It typically grows in coastal or lowland areas, often in sandy or gravelly soils. Pearsonia mucronata is a relatively small shrub, rarely exceeding a meter in height.
